title: Your First Analytics App on DataStax Enterprise | DataStax Enterprise Recipes
description:
Full tutorial + resources: http://bit.ly/tutorials-recipes | A brief guide on how to Setup Your First Analytics App on DataStax Enterprise. We have lots of helpful videos on DataStax Academy. Some cover big topics, like Apache Cassandra data modeling and some answer single questions like how do I install DataStax Enterprise. If our big course-long topics are "full course meals," these single question, DataStax Enterprise Recipes are "quick snacks."

ABOUT DATASTAX ENTERPRISE 5
DataStax Enterprise 5.0, the database platform for cloud applications, includes Apache Cassandra 3.x with materialized views, tiered storage and advanced replication. Introduced in 5.0 is DataStax Enterprise Graph, the first graph database fast enough to power customer-facing applications, scale to massive datasets and integrate advanced tools to power deep analytical queries.

Learn more at http://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-enterprise and https://academy.datastax.com/resources/whats-new-datastax-enterprise-50

CONNECT WITH DATASTAX
Subscribe: http://www.youtube.com/c/datastax?sub_confirmation=1 
Site: http://datastax.com 
Facebook: https://facebook.com/datastax 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/datastax 
Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/datastax
http://feeds.feedburner.com/datastax 
https://github.com/datastax 

ABOUT DATASTAX ACADEMY
On the DataStax Academy YouTube channel, you can find tutorials, webinars and much more to help you learn and stay updated with the latest information on DataStax EnterpriseÂ©.  Create an account on https://academy.datastax.com to watch our free online courses, tutorials, and more.

transcript.text: hi I'm Tim Bergland and this is your first dates tax Enterprise spark application we get a few recipes that tell you how to get set up with data stacks Enterprise locally once you've got it up and running it's time to do some analytics start up your data stacks enterprise instance with the dash K option which enables SPARC I'm going to run sequel shell I'm also going to run a small script which is going to set up a key space and a table and load that table with data the example data is a table of movies as well as other associated tables as you can see here from there run DSE spark to get the SPARC shell the SPARC shell is actually a Scala repple with a spark context object already available and connected to your data stacks Enterprise analytics node it's pretty easy to query data from a cassandra table and turn it into a spark RDD just like this I can inspect a few of the records in that table right here from the spark shell an RDD is like a big programmable bucket of records that can be distributed over all of the analytics nodes in our data stacks enterprise cluster we do some pretty cool stuff like using the reduced by key operation to see how many movies Johnny Depp was in for each year a slightly more sophisticated way to do that same query is to use the data frame API like I'm showing you here now we're going to filter out Johnny Depp's 3 most productive years in terms of the number of release films and their average rating there is so much more to learn about spark which we cover in depth on data stacks Academy in the course we affectionately call ds3 20 be sure to check it out and we'll turn you into a spark expert in no time
